Novosibirsk lies in the heart of Russia and Russian culture.

The Opera

Price: 400 - 5000 Rubles/show

The Novosibirsk Opera and Ballet Theatre is the largest in Russia, and perhaps the most renowned. Located in Lenin Square (city center), the Opera with it's giant dome that represents Novosibirsk. You can find tickets here.

Alexander Nevsky Cathedral

Distance: 2km from city center; easy to walk, bus if necessary

Price: Free

Built in 1898, the Alexander Nevsky Cathedral is one of the most beautiful architectures in Russia. The building is a mix of red brick, golden domes, and religious murals. Anyone can walk up to and in the cathedral, and if you’re there on Sunday, you may get to hear the semi-dissonant ringing of the bells.

find on 2GIS.

Central Siberian Botanical Garden

Distance: 34km from city centre; 2 hours by bus, 45 minutes by car/taxi

Price: Free

What to see This garden is a bit of a hike south from the center of the city, but well worth it if you’re a lover of nature. It’s a wonderful place to take pictures and enjoy the outdoors in the shade of some beautiful trees. The gardens are full of many different species, which you can find out more about on their official site

find on 2GIS

Central Park of Culture and Recreation

Distance: <1 km

Price: Free

What to see Central Park is popular among the locals in every season, full of ice slides and sculptures in the winter and fair-like attractions in the summer. It’s a good place to spend some of the day, walking around or riding the wooden roller coaster. There is also a cafe in the park where you can grab some coffee or tea to enjoy.

find on 2GIS

Monument to First Traffic Light

Distance: 1.3 km; easy to walk

Price: Free

What to see The Monument to the First Traffic Light is a must-see in Novosibirsk (even if you’re only here for a little bit of time). It’s a wonderful monument displaying the sort of pride Russian culture brings to their achievements.

Find on 2GIS

Chapel of St. Nicholas

Distance: The chapel is actually the centre of Russia

Price: Free

What to see The Chapel of St. Nicholas is the “supposed” geographic center of Russia. It’s quaint little church where a lucky couple is likely to be found wedding. .

find on 2GIS

Museums

The World Funeral Culture Museum

Distance: 1 hr by bus (two buses from city center). A taxi can sometimes be cheaper and faster if you're with a group.

Price: 150 rubles +50 rub if you want to take photos. 250 rub regular price

What to seeThe World Funeral Culture Museum is one of the more off-beat places to visit in Novosibirsk. Surrounded by graves and a crematorium, it has a more eerie presence. Inside you can find everything to do with death, from tomb stones, to window-wear, to figurines of cars carrying the dead. .
